scene_target: Artie's mundane life ends in a ridiculous vending machine accident, setting the stage for his reincarnation.
goal: Establish Artie's character, his low luck, and the inciting incident of his death.
conflict: Artie vs. a malfunctioning vending machine that has 'stolen' his last dollar.
end_condition: Artie is electrocuted by the vending machine and dies.

last_scene: Artie attempted to purchase a bag of chips from a malfunctioning vending machine using a Crumpled Dollar Bill.
The machine jammed, leading Artie to shake it aggressively, which triggered a fatal high-voltage electrical surge.
Artie was electrocuted and died on the breakroom floor as the chips finally fell.
key_events: Artie smoothed and fed the Crumpled Dollar Bill into the Snack-o-Matic 3000 after several failed attempts.
The machine jammed on the last bag of Cool Ranch chips, leaving them dangling over the drop zone.
Artie shook the machine to dislodge the snack, triggering a high-pitched electronic whine and a massive discharge.
A blue arc of electricity struck Artie in the chest, using his Corporate ID Badge as a lightning rod.
Artie died instantly, his consciousness flickering as reality stability dropped to 99%.
The bag of chips fell onto Artie's chest after his death.
